00005     public static String Capitalize(String str){
00006             return Character.toUpperCase(str.charAt(0)) + str.substring(1);
00007     }
00008 
00009     public static String AllCapsToCapitalized(String str){
00010             return str.charAt(0) + str.substring(1).toLowerCase();
00011     }

00014         return "<" + str + ">" ;
00015     }

00018         return "<" + str + ">" ;
00019     }

00022     {
00023         return startTag(Ident) + middle +endTag(Ident);

00029 /*
00030  * Java ME/blackberry strings leave out a lot of the useful functions
00031  * such as split. So this is an extremely simple substitute for this project(not meant to be a general solution.
00032  * Assumes neither start nor end character are splitters and that splitters don't occur in a row
00033  */
00034         public static String[] split(String stringToSplit, char splitter) {
00035                 if(stringToSplit==null)
00036                         return null;
00037                 int i;
00038                 int numChars=stringToSplit.length();//caches length of full string
00039                 char [] charArrayToSplit=stringToSplit.toCharArray();
00040                 int [] splitterLocations=new int[numChars];//sets up array to be used for recording where splits should happen
00041                 splitterLocations[0]=0;
00042         STuple [] stringSplitingArray=new STuple[numChars];
00043         int numOfSplitTupples=0;
00044                 int numOfSplitters=0;//counts how many splitters there are
00045                 String [] ArrayofSplitStrings;
00046                 int lastSplitter=stringToSplit.lastIndexOf(splitter);
00047                 int lastsplit=0;
00048                 int begin = 0;
00049                 int end = 0;
00050                 char [] allSplitters=new char[numChars];
00051                 if(stringToSplit.indexOf(splitter)==-1)
00052                     {
00053                         ArrayofSplitStrings=new String[1];
00054                         ArrayofSplitStrings[0]=stringToSplit;
00055                         return ArrayofSplitStrings;//no splitters in string
00056                     }
00057                 for(i=0;i<numChars;i++){
00058                         allSplitters[i]=splitter;
00059                 }
00060                 if((new String(allSplitters).equals(stringToSplit)))//do we have a string that only has splitters then return null
00061                         return null;
00062         while((end=stringToSplit.indexOf(' ',end))!=-1){
00063 
00064             if(begin<numChars-1){
00065                                 stringSplitingArray[numOfSplitTupples]=new STuple(new Integer(begin),new Integer(end));
00066                                 begin=end+1;
00067                                 numOfSplitters++;
00068                     }
00069             else
00070                 break;
00071                 }
00072                 ArrayofSplitStrings= new String[numOfSplitters];
00073                 for(i=0;i<=numOfSplitters;i++)
00074                         ArrayofSplitStrings[i]=stringToSplit.substring(((Integer)stringSplitingArray[i].First()).intValue(),((Integer)stringSplitingArray[i].Second()).intValue());//String.substtring(begin,end) returns from begin to end-1
00075                 return ArrayofSplitStrings;
00076         }
00077 }
